page.title: 01Framlingham,an introduction
page.content: Framlingham is a small market town in Suffolk surrounded by countryside. It is mainly arable land with several farms. Framlingham has many good shops, enough for itself and the area around. It also has three schools, a primary school, a comprehensive school and a public school,Framlingham College. It has attractions including a 12th Cent. castle and an impressive church. For the many visitors there are places to stay, the largest is the Crown Hotel. The population is around 2,300, with many pleasant people. Framlingham is 19 miles north of Ipswich. There is a market on Saturdays. We have a fire station with its own crew of part-time firemen. There is a police station with its own sergeant and 4 constables. The nearest hospital is in Ipswich but there is a modern surgery with three doctors.
